references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of topic modeling and provides a comprehensive overview of probabilistic topic models, which are frequently used as baselines in the current work.

This paper introduced Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA), a highly influential probabilistic topic model that serves as a fundamental baseline and inspiration for many subsequent topic modeling approaches.

This paper introduced the Variational Autoencoder (VAE), a powerful deep generative model that has been widely adopted in various fields, including topic modeling, and several VAE-based topic models are referenced in the current work.
This paper significantly advanced the field by demonstrating the effectiveness of topic modeling using pretrained word embeddings, which is directly relevant to the methodology of the current work.

references.paper_title: BERTopic: Neural topic modeling with a class-based tf-idf procedure
references.reason: This paper introduced BERTopic, a highly cited and competitive neural topic modeling method that is frequently used as a baseline in the current work, and its approach of clustering document embeddings is compared and contrasted with the approach in this paper.
